title: Quotient Rule of Exponents
text: For any real number a and natural numbers $$m$$ and $$n$$, such that $$m>n$$, the quotient rule of exponents states that $$\frac{a^m}{a^n}=a^{m-n}$$

title: Quotient Rule of Exponents
text: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression: $$\frac{\left({de}^2\right)^{11}}{{2\left({de}^2\right)}^{11}}=\frac{1}{2} \left({de}^2\right)^{11-11}=\frac{1}{2} \left({de}^2\right)^0$$

title: Zero Exponent Rule
text: For any nonzero real number a, the zero exponent rule of exponents states that $$a^0=1$$

title: Simplify
text: Use the Zero Exponent Rule to simplify the expression: $$\frac{1}{2} \left({de}^2\right)^0=1\frac{1}{2}$$
